{"step_by_step_thinking": "The hypothalamus controls the release of hormones from the pituitary gland, including both prolactin and growth hormone (GH). The hypothalamus releases inhibitory hormones, such as dopamine, which inhibits the release of prolactin, and somatostatin, which inhibits the release of GH. Therefore, both prolactin and GH are under the inhibitory control of the hypothalamus.", "answer_choice": "D. Both GH and prolactin"}
